line_1: Rang'd o'er the Vallies with his darling Tray,
line_2: Or near some Fountain slumber'd out the Day:

line_1: And fetch, and carry, like a two-leg'd tray;
line_2: Make coffee, when my lady calls, or whey,

line_1: And wherever I went, was my poor dog Tray.
line_2: No harp like my own could so cheerily play,

line_1: And be kind, my dear Pat, to our poor dog Tray.
line_2: Oh! remember your Sheelah when far far away;

line_1: I had always a friend in my poor dog Tray.
line_2: When the sour-looking folks sent me heartless away,

line_1: And he lick'd me for kindness — my poor dog Tray.
line_2: How snugly we slept in my old coat of grey,

line_1: And I play'd a sad lament for my poor dog Tray.
line_2: But he died at my feet on a cold winter day,

line_1: I can never more return with my poor dog Tray.
line_2: To my sweet native village, so far, far away?

line_1: And in my service copy Tray.
line_2: I mark his true, his faithful way,
